title: Who agrees that the Tesla Cybertruck is the first ugly Tesla? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m not a fan of the Cybertruck styling, but I’m not a fan of ANY pickup truck or SUV styling (maybe it has something to do with my name :) I prefer small vehicles with smooth lines, not highly angular, boxy vehicles. But here’s the interesting thing. When I was growing up in the late 70’s and 80’s and starting to pay more attention to cars, all the cars were boxy!    I remember seeing the first cars in the 80’s with rounded edges and sloped back roofs and thought how strange and ugly they looked. And now I drive one!  I can’t say for sure what I would have thought (in the 80’s) that the Model 3 was off-putting, but now I think it is beautiful! I also can’t say for sure whether the look of the Tesla Cybertruck will ever grow on me (or at least others who don’t think ALL trucks look ugly), but I will say this: Pickup trucks and large SUVs, the way they are shaped today, are horribly aerodynamically inefficient. Truck owners basically will have 4 choices going forward: Continue to use gas & diesel to fuel their transportation in their traditional vehicles, although this option will continue to get more and more expensive as others opt for more efficient means of transportation and volumes of internal combustion vehicles declinePut up with relatively short ranges in their electric trucks (100–150 miles). This will probably be a reasonable option for many who only need their trucks to get them around town.Pay exorbitant prices for traditionally shaped, but long range electric trucks.Submit to the idea that a more aerodynamic shape is needed (not necessarily saying Cybertruck shaped) for decent cost & functionality (range) of their trucks and acknowledge that as long as it can get the job done, that an nontraditional looking truck might be the better solution.Given how cost conscious and wrapped up with “range” most people are, I think the number of people opting for #1–3 are going to decline in the future.
